lead_paragraph: Millions of people looking for insurance in the federal marketplaces are more concerned with cost than with finding a favorite doctor or trusted company.

headline.print_headline: Health Insurers Lose as Clients Focus on Costs
headline.main: Cost, Not Choice, Is Top Concern of Health Insurance Customers

snippet: Millions of people looking for insurance in the federal marketplaces are more concerned with cost than with finding a favorite doctor or trusted company....
abstract: Fewer healthy people than expected have signed up for coverage through federal health insurance marketplace, contributing to million of dollars in losses among top insurers in United States; situation has led some to question whether major insurance companies will stay in marketplaces, and if they do, be able to fulfill intention of 2010 Affordable Care Act to offer public wide array of plans.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
